After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Invent.EXPLANATION: Number of times inventory is sold and replaced within a specified period, indicating the efficiency of inventory management.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Invent.FORMULA: Cost of Goods Sold / Average Inventory

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Invent.EXPLANATION: Percentage of inventory records that match the actual physical inventory, reflecting the accuracy of inventory tracking systems.
Percentage of inventory items that are out of stock compared to the total number of items, indicating the effectiveness of inventory management.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Invent.FORMULA: (Number of Stockouts / Total Number of Items) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Invent.EXPLANATION: Average cost of holding one unit of inventory, including storage, insurance, and obsolescence costs.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Invent.FORMULA: Total Inventory Carrying Cost / Total Number of Units

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Invent.EXPLANATION: Measure of the accuracy of inventory aging reports, reflecting how well the system tracks the age of inventory items.
Percentage of inventory items that are no longer useful or saleable, indicating issues with inventory management and forecasting.
Measure of how effectively inventory management costs are controlled and utilized, calculated as the ratio of total inventory costs to managed inventory value.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Invent.FORMULA: Total Inventory Management Cost / Total Inventory Value

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Invent.EXPLANATION: Degree to which inventory management practices adhere to established policies and procedures, measured through audits and performance evaluations.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Invent.FORMULA: (Number of Compliant Inventory Instances / Total Number of Inventory Instances) * 100
